thread.title: Shoreditch High Street evacuated after discovery of unexploded bomb | Metro News
thread.title_full: Shoreditch High Street evacuated after discovery of unexploded bomb | Metro News

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Shoreditch High Street evacuated after discovery of unexploded bomb | Metro News
text:
Richard Hartley-Parkinson for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 9:45 am #Shoreditch High St is CLOSED both ways at Great Eastern St due to an police incident. Drivers are advised to seek an alternative route pic.twitter.com/XNwCks2DJ0 
— Ramón Sánchez (@Pequelord) February 27, 2017 
Part of Shoreditch High Street has been closed off this morning after the discovery of a suspected unexploded World War Two bomb. 
Bomb squad trucks were called to deal with the explosive shortly after 9am today while police were ushering people away from the scene. 
A cordon has been set up preventing people from getting close to the device before the road was re-opened half an hour later. 
Met Police said that officers were investigating the possible shell. Good morning !!! La journée commence avec une alerte et l'évacuation de notre hôtel #Enjoy #UnPeuFlippant #Shoreditch #London @acehotel pic.twitter.com/reOgRG8kvs 
— Nicolas Mouton (@NicolasMouton) February 27, 2017 Shoreditch High Street is cut off by the police right now pic.twitter.com/b4RW32K3a1 
— Alexander Savin (@alexsavinme) February 27, 2017 More
